subject: The CNN Political Ticker PM, Thursday, May 10, 2007
body:
CNN.com - CNN Political Ticker










For the latest, breaking political news, check for updates
throughout the day on the CNN Political Ticker
http://www.cnn.com/ticker All politics, all the
time.

Today on the Ticker

Bush says he's OK with Iraq benchmarks

WASHINGTON (AP) -- President Bush, under growing
political pressure, said Thursday the White House will seek
agreement with Congress on benchmarks to measure progress in
Iraq.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/10/us.iraq.ap/index.html

***

Reid: Benchmarks need
consequences

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Senate
Majority Leader Harry Reid, D-Nevada, said Thursday that any
benchmarks in the new emergency supplemental spending bill must
carry consequences if they are not met.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/reid-benchmarks-need-consequences.html

***

Giuliani to outline abortion rights
support

NEW YORK (CNN) -- Republican
presidential hopeful Rudy Giuliani will fully outline his views
on abortion prior to next week's GOP debate in South Carolina,
Giuliani advisers tells CNN. The former New York City mayor's
remarks will reassert his personal opposition to abortion, but
also emphasize his support for a woman's right to choose.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/giuliani-to-outline-abortion-rights.html

***

Bush on Blair: 'I'll miss' him

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- President Bush said Thursday he will
"miss" outgoing British Prime Minister Tony Blair, and called
him "a man who's kept his word."

Full
story:http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bush-on-blair-ill-miss-him.html

***

White House: Blair 'extraordinary leader'

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- White House spokesman Tony Snow
called outgoing British Prime Minister Tony Blair "an
extraordinary leader" Thursday, and said the president
appreciates "everything he has done."

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/white-house-blair-extraordinary-leader.html

***

Gonzales tells panel he doesn't recall any
more details

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Democrats
pressed Thursday for more answers on the firings of U.S.
attorneys as Attorney General Alberto Gonzales insisted he
hasn't remembered anything new and Republicans demanded the
investigation close.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/2007/POLITICS/05/10/gonzales.testifies.ap/index.html

***

Protesters
disrupt Gonzales hearing

WASHINGTON (CNN) --
Eight female protesters from the anti war group Code Pink were
removed from a House Judiciary hearing with Attorney Gen.
Alberto Gonzales Thursday.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/prote
sters-disrupt-gonzales-hearing.html

***

Immunity request to be formally submitted for
Goodling

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- The counsel to
the House of Representatives is expected to file paperwork with
a federal judge Friday requesting immunity for former top
Justice official Monica Goodling, a House aide tells CNN.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/immunity-request-to-be-formally.html

***

Sharpton seeks dialogue with Romney

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- Rev. Al Sharpton called on former
Massachusetts Gov. Mitt Romney to "engage in a dialogue of
reconciliation" Thursday, a day after the two exchanged a war
of words over Sharpton's comments about the Mormon faith.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/sharpton-seeks-dialogue-with-romney.html

***

Edwards' daughter defends decision to continue
campaign

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Cate Edwards, the
25-year-old daughter of presidential hopeful John Edwards, is
behind her parents' decision to continue the campaign despite
Elizabeth Edwards' incurable cancer.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/edwards-daughter-defends-decision-to.html

***

McCain: Show me the money

WASHINGTON (CNN) -- After disappointing first quarter
fundraising numbers, Sen. John McCain, R-Arizona, is boosting
his efforts with a money-raising binge all over the country.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/mccain-show-me-money.html

***

'08ers list their wheels

WASHINGTON (AP) -- Hybrids are gaining in popularity in the
political class, judging from the cars of choice of the
presidential candidates.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/08ers-list-their-wheels.html

***

Bloomberg's Web site latest sign of bid?

NEW YORK (AP) -- Mayor Michael Bloomberg, who insists
he is not running for president, has re-launched the Web site
he used for his mayoral campaigns in 2001 and 2005,
http://www.mikebloomberg.com.

Full story:
http://www.cnn.com/POLITICS/blogs/politicalticker/2007/05/bloombergs-web-site-latest-sign-of-bid.html
